dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, big news coming out of the EU today, right? Brexit is officially delayed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, big news coming out of the E U today, right? Brexit is officially delayed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: EU leaders have agreed to grant the U.K. a three-month delay to Brexit, meaning the October 31 exit deadline has been extended until January 31, 2020, at the latest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for real. I mean, remember Johnson said he'd rather be dead in a ditch than delay? [chuckles]
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for real. I mean, remember Johnson said he'd rather be dead in a ditch than delay?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson has previously said he would rather be dead in a ditch than to further delay

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] I know, right? Well, looks like he's, uh, not quite in a ditch, but definitely delayed. It's a three-month extension, actually. Until January 31st.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? Well, looks like he's, uh, not quite in a ditch, but definitely delayed. It's a three-month extension, actually. Until January thirty first.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: EU leaders have agreed to grant the U.K. a three-month delay to Brexit, meaning the October 31 exit deadline has been extended until January 31, 2020, at the latest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Tusk called it a "flextension," didn't he? Like, they *could* leave earlier if a deal gets ratified?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Tusk called it a flextension, didn't he? Like, they could leave earlier if a deal gets ratified?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He said: The EU27 has agreed that it will accept the U.K.s request for a Brexit flextension until 31 January 2020. The flextension means that the U.K. would be allowed to leave the EU before January 31, if the British and European Parliaments ratifiy a deal before then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. If both Parliaments, uh, you know, agree on a deal before then, they're out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. If both Parliaments, uh, you know, agree on a deal before then, they're out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The flextension means that the U.K. would be allowed to leave the EU before January 31, if the British and European Parliaments ratifiy a deal before then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what forced Johnson's hand here, really? Like, why did he even ask for this delay after all that bluster?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what forced Johnson's hand here, really? Like, why did he even ask for this delay after all that bluster?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, his Brexit bill, um, was blocked twice in the British Parliament. So he was legally compelled to send that letter to the EU.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, his Brexit bill, um, was blocked twice in the British Parliament. So he was legally compelled to send that letter to the E U.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It comes after British Prime Minister Boris Johnson was forced to send a letter to the EU requesting an extension, after a vote on his Brexit bill was blocked, twice.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which means, what, he's just going to push for a general election now, right? In December?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which means, what, he's just going to push for a general election now, right? In December?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The move now means Johnson will push for a general election this December, with British lawmakers set to debate the move this afternoon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the plan. Lawmakers are, uh, debating that this afternoon, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the plan. Lawmakers are, uh, debating that this afternoon, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The move now means Johnson will push for a general election this December, with British lawmakers set to debate the move this afternoon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. All that talk about 'do or die' on October 31st, and here we are.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. All that talk about do or die on October thirty first, and here we are.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson has repeatedly said that he wanted the U.K. to leave the EU on October 31 do or die, but that certainly will not happen now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it certainly won't happen now. He was, like, literally forced by law to ask for the extension.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it certainly won't happen now. He was, like, literally forced by law to ask for the extension.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson was forced by law to ask the EU for an extension earlier this month, after he failed to get his Brexit deal approved by U.K. parliamentarians.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Because he couldn't get his deal approved, even though parliamentarians, um, technically approved it *in principle* last week, didn't they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because he couldn't get his deal approved, even though parliamentarians, um, technically approved it in principle last week, didn't they?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last week, lawmakers approved Johnsons deal in principle, by voting to approve Johnsons Withdrawal Agreement Bill, which sets out the terms of the U.K.s exit from the EU.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They did! But then they rejected the short window he gave them to debate it. Classic, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did! But then they rejected the short window he gave them to debate it. Classic, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson then paused the deal after lawmakers rejected a short three-day window in which to debate it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] So he's basically saying, 'Okay, fine, you want to debate it? You agree to a December 12th election.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So he's basically saying, Okay, fine, you want to debate it? You agree to a December twelfth election.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But for the bill to progress further, Johnson said on Friday that he would allow lawmakers to debate it if they agreed to allowing an election on December 12.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's, uh, quite the chess game, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. It's, uh, quite the chess game, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And we're all just watching the clock tick, again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And we're all just watching the clock tick, again.
